text: Hi Muniza! I think that lipsync and some sort of body mechanic is good to have (maybe do something short from your favourite musical for that?) that way you're incorporating both mecanics and lipsync for less work and more dedication seeing as it's something you're interested in.

I think that the timing of becoming a senior animator depends entirely on the person. I was quite lucky in that it's only taken me three years to go from junior to senior animator. That's because I've been lucky with who my animation directors are and also because I've worked really hard. When you show that you're interested in learning and progressing, people are willing to take a chance on you.

The hardest thing is that it takes patience though, and that is something that is very hard to master. I still struggle with it a lot if I'm honest. But I have made myself a career success diary over the years and whenever I look back on it I am able to appreciate my hard work. Really recommend that
